Sentencas: Hydrogen is yet to be widely accepted as a fuel for everyday operation due to stringent safety regulations involved around it.
Titulo: Methanol based Solid Oxide Reversible energy storage system - Does it make sense thermodynamically?

Sentencas: In the meanwhile, methanol could be a potential fuel of the future.
Titulo: Methanol based Solid Oxide Reversible energy storage system - Does it make sense thermodynamically?

Sentencas: In this work, an extensive thermodynamic investigation on an energy storage system with a reversible solid oxide stack at its core is presented.
Titulo: Methanol based Solid Oxide Reversible energy storage system - Does it make sense thermodynamically?

Sentencas: The current investigated system can operate either as an electrolyzer or as a fuel cell.
Titulo: Methanol based Solid Oxide Reversible energy storage system - Does it make sense thermodynamically?

Sentencas: It uses steam for electrolysis (charging mode) and methanol for fuel cell operation (discharging mode).
Titulo: Methanol based Solid Oxide Reversible energy storage system - Does it make sense thermodynamically?

Sentencas: A process model of the entire system is formulated by using Aspen PlusTM.
Titulo: Methanol based Solid Oxide Reversible energy storage system - Does it make sense thermodynamically?

Sentencas: Energy and exergy efficiency have been reported for both modes of operation, along with maximum roundtrip efficiency that can be achieved for the entire system operation.
Titulo: Methanol based Solid Oxide Reversible energy storage system - Does it make sense thermodynamically?

Sentencas: Results indicate that during electrolysis mode, a maximum energy and exergy efficiency of 67.94% and 72.30% can be achieved and for fuel cell mode operation, the numbers are 74.14% and 62.61% respectively.
Titulo: Methanol based Solid Oxide Reversible energy storage system - Does it make sense thermodynamically?

Sentencas: The maximum reported value of RT efficiency is 64.32% which is quite high considering the infancy of reversible solid oxide technology and the fact that methanol is used as the fuel.
Titulo: Methanol based Solid Oxide Reversible energy storage system - Does it make sense thermodynamically?
